p: Chikungunya (CHIKV) is an arbovirus that causes a febrile illness, and belongs to the family Togaviridae and genus Alphavirus. CHIKV is transmitted by vectors belonging to genus Aedes, primarily Ae. aegypti and Ae. albopictus [ 1]. CHIKV had been limited to Asia and Africa until 2007 when the virus reached Europe, causing sporadic outbreaks, and finally the Americas in 2013, where it quickly caused over 1 million cases [ 2]. The subsequent Colombian epidemic of CHIKV accounts for approximately 49.15% of cases in Latin America as reported by the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) [ 3].
